zone.line: cold rain that that fell about my heart
has acted like the waters of the fountain ^cavern
of Antiparos and has changed my heart ^it
to stone. I do not weep or sigh; but I
must reason with myself, and force
myself to feel sorrow and despair. This is
not resignation that I feel, for I am dead
to all regret
Thus I communed ^in this manner with myself,
but I was silent to all around me. I
hardly replied to the stig slightest ques
tion, and was uneasy when I saw a
human creature near me. I was
surrounded by my female relations, but
they were all of them nearly strangers to
me: I did not listen to their consola-
tions; and so little did they work their
designed effect that they seemed to
me to be spoken in an unknown
tongue. I found if sorrow were ^was dead
within me, so was love and the desire of
